headline.main: 3 Hybrids By Porsche Tailored To the Task

docs.lead_paragraph: The automaker has jumped ahead in the development of hybrid powertrains by unveiling three systems engineered for very different applications.

headline.seo: After Suicides, Foxconn Will Outsource Its Worker Dorms
headline.print_headline: A Chinese Factory Outsources Worker Dorms
headline.main: A Chinese Factory Outsources Worker Dorms

docs.lead_paragraph: Under scrutiny after several suicides at its factories in China, Foxconn Technology, a supplier to Apple, Dell and Hewlett-Packard, has decided to stop operating dormitories for workers.

docs.abstract: Bits blog notes iDent Technology has motion-sensing chip for cellphones; photo (S)

headline.main: A Gadget to Ring the Body Electric

docs.lead_paragraph: Evolution has been so cruel, burdening us with fingers. Thank heaven there are engineers hard at work making sure we can live without them. At the Mobile World Congress, a German company called iDent Technology demonstrated technology that seems to control cellphones almost by magic.

docs.abstract: Gadgetwise blog notes Kingston introduces its DT-310 hard drive, 256-gigabyte USB flash drive priced at $1,108; photo (S)

headline.main: A Heavyweight Flash Drive, Priced to Match

docs.lead_paragraph: It has a larger capacity than the hard drive on many computers, but is significantly smaller than a Snickers bar. It also costs way more than a standard drive or a candy bar. Kingston has just released the DT-310, for DataTraveler, a 256-gigabyte U.S.B. flash drive that costs $1,108. It can store up to 54 full-length movies or enough music to let you play a different CD each day for a year.

docs.abstract: Bill Watkins, who was ousted from Seagate Technology last year, is becoming the chief executive of Bridgelux, an LED start-up that has raised $122 million.

headline.main: Former Seagate C.E.O. Bill Watkins Joins an LED Start-Up

docs.lead_paragraph: Seagate Technology, the big hard drive company, surprised people last January when the board abruptly fired its outspoken and candid chief executive, Bill Watkins. A year later, Mr. Watkins, as outspoken as ever, has resurfaced as the chief executive of an LED start-up called Bridgelux.
docs.snippet: Bill Watkins, who was ousted from Seagate Technology last year, is becoming the chief executive of Bridgelux, an LED start-up that has raised $122 million....
